thread.title: Chelsea could beat Premier League rivals Liverpool to the bargain £8million signing of Borussia Monchengladbach midfielder Mahmoud Dahoud
thread.title_full: Chelsea could beat Premier League rivals Liverpool to the bargain £8million signing of Borussia Monchengladbach midfielder Mahmoud Dahoud

author: wally Downes
title: Chelsea could beat Premier League rivals Liverpool to the bargain £8million signing of Borussia Monchengladbach midfielder Mahmoud Dahoud

persons.name: mahmoud dahoud efl mahmoud killer chelsea

text:
EFL MAHMOUD KILLER Chelsea could beat Premier League rivals Liverpool to the bargain £8million signing of Borussia Monchengladbach midfielder Mahmoud Dahoud 
Box-to-box midfielder has rejected new terms in Germany and his struggling side could cash in on the playmaker by WALLY DOWNES JR Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments CHELSEA hope to beat Liverpool and Borussia Dortmund to the bargain signing of Borussia Monchegladbach contract rebel Mahmoud Dahoud in the summer. 
The highly-rated midfielder is out of contract at the Bundesliga club in the summer of 2018 and he has rejected offers to update his deal and stay on. Getty Images 4 Mahmoud Dahoud could be finishing his last season in Germany as two Prem sides circle around him 
There were reports that Jurgen Klopp’s former side had already beaten his current one to the 21-year-old’s signature for as little as £10million. 
But the Premier League’s runaway leaders are now in the frame, which is sure to drive his prices up, after they failed to land fellow box-to-box midfielder Frank Kessie in January, reports the Guardian . 
Dahoud was born in currently war-torn Syria but at 10 months old he and his family fled for Europe where he has grown up and represented Germany at youth levels. EPA The powerful No8 gets all over the pitch and never avoids a crunching tackle in the Bundesliga EPA 4 Chelsea and Liverpool could both fit the Germany youth star into their squads and develop him 
This season the all-action star has appeared in 15 league matches but he has been withdrawn in seven of those and returned just one goal. 
But his all-round game is powerful with attractive stats for tackles and interceptions and distances ran. 
Chelsea don’t look desperately short of midfield options right now, as they coast toward the title, but they will need a handful of top players next season when they compete in the Champions League. Related stories SING WHEN YOU'RE WINNING X Factor star Jake Quickenden tunes up for Lincoln's FA Cup clash with Burnley where he'll be cheering on best pal Jack Muldoon 'Artwarming Joy as Bournemouth midfielder Harry Arter and partner Rachel welcome new baby Raine Karren Brady Slaven Bilic's touchline temper tantrum was bad... but refs are getting more decisions wrong this season FOLLOWERS OF PASSION Lincoln's Cowley brothers are obsessed with football... and their eye for detail has turned Non-League Imps into feared giant-slayers ROO BETTER BELIEVE IT Manchester United could still flog skipper Wayne Rooney this month despite transfer window closing Getty Images Kop boss Jurgen Klopp has looked at the Syria-birn star before and PSG made a massive offer last summer Jurgen Klopp on Oxlade-Chamberlain rumours and the return of Sergio Aguero 
Dahoud would offer an alternative to Nemaja Matic and N'Golo Kante who would be hard-pressed to maintain their form at home and abroad next season. 
Last August Paris St Germain allegedly offered around £35m for the star and that was rejected as Gladbach were cashing on Granit Xhaka going to Arsenal at the time and could not afford to lose both. 
But the German club has tumbled out of the Champions League places and the player’s firm contract rejection has meant his price has plummeted and he could be picked up for a snip. Watch some of Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp's best bits and funniest bits
